articles.title: Japan to invest $36 billion in US projects under trade pact, says Trump
articles.description: Japan will invest $36 billion in three U.S. projects, including a $33 billion natural gas power plant in Ohio and a $2.1 billion oil export terminal in Texas. A synthetic industrial diamond factory in Georgia, valued at $600 million, will also be established. These investments are the first under Japan's $550 billion U.S. pledge.
articles.content:

articles.title: Reserve Bank leaves official cash rate at 2.25%
articles.description: Anna Breman says economy is recovering but unemployment remains high, wage growth modest.
articles.content:
The Reserve Bank has held the official cash rate unchanged at 2.25 percent
New governor Anna Breman has emphasised a 'laser focus' on low inflation
Forecasts indicate the next OCR move will be a rise early next year

articles.title: Ethiopia EV Boom Sparked by ICE Car Import Ban
articles.description: The East African country is making use of cheap hydropower and Chinese electric vehicles to ditch the internal combustion engine.
articles.content: Bethelhem Eshetie gave up driving her taxi two years ago. The rising cost of gas and the spare parts needed to keep her old car on the road meant that she couldn’t earn enough to make ends meet. “It was no longer worth it,” she said. Six months later... [404 chars]

articles.title: Can Big Oil Succeed Where Diplomacy Has Failed in Libya?
articles.description: Libya’s first post-Gaddafi licensing round has drawn major Western oil companies back to its vast reserves, but unresolved political fractures threaten to undermine hopes of a sustained production revival.
articles.content: Libya’s first oil field licensing round since the removal of Muammar Gaddafi as leader in 2011 has seen a slew of major Western international oil companies (IOCs) choose to either re-enter the country after a long absence or bolster their existing op... [8259 chars]

articles.title: Trump is loosening America’s grip on its banks
articles.description: The Donald Trump administration is close to finalising a new set of rules for its banks as it looks to turbocharge US economic growth. The consequences could be damaging.

articles.title: Warren Buffett Dumped Shares of Amazon, Apple, and Bank of America, and Added One Brand-New Stock in His Final Quarter Before Retirement
articles.description: The Oracle of Omaha's final quarter as Berkshire Hathaway CEO revealed more significant net selling activity, and one curious $352 million purchase.
articles.content: Data is the fuel that keeps Wall Street running -- and few announcements are more telling than the quarterly filing of Form 13F with the Securities and Exchange Commission. A 13F provides investors with a road map of the stocks that Wall Street's sav... [3418 chars]

articles.title: Tesla Teases First Cybercab to Come Off the Production Line
articles.description: Tesla said the Cybercab, a purpose-built robotaxi, just reached a critical manufacturing milestone. The car is intended for Tesla's Robotaxi service.
articles.content:
Tesla says its purpose-built robotaxi just reached an important manufacturing milestone.
In an X post on Tuesday, the company said the Cybercab, a two-door car without a steering wheel, came off the production line at Tesla's sprawling Gigafactory in... [1724 chars]
